response.overview: The contrast between myth and reality: The story looks back at how the surviving flag-raisers were used as symbols for a war bond drive, revealing the uncomfortable truth behind their manufactured heroism. The three survivors—John Bradley, Ira Hayes, and Rene Gagnon—were deeply traumatized by the battle and felt immense guilt over being celebrated when their friends had died. The film's non-linear structure weaves together scenes from the war bond tour with flashbacks to the brutal fighting on Iwo Jima, consistently forcing the characters to confront their past
response.title: Looking Into The Past
